Main Answer:
BitPay acknowledges its dual role as both a controller and processor of personal data under the GDPR. As a controller, BitPay determines the purposes and means of processing personal data, as outlined in the Privacy Notice. When acting as a processor, BitPay processes personal data on behalf of and following the instructions of the controller.

Key Points:
• BitPay's primary responsibility as a controller is to ensure compliance with data protection laws, including the GDPR, when processing personal data.
• As a processor, BitPay is bound by the instructions of the controller and must process data in accordance with the law and the controller's directions.
• BitPay may share personal data with third parties, including authorities and law enforcement, in specific circumstances such as legal obligations, suspected illegal activities, or Terms of Use violations.
• The company's location in the United States and the potential for data transfers outside the EEA are addressed with appropriate safeguards to ensure compliance with the GDPR.
